parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.08

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Sides

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Locations

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets a location's [[Side|side]]. The default side is Unknown.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> location '''setSide''' side

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> location: [[Location]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> side: [[Side]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>myLocation [[setSide]] [[resistance]]</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[Side]], [[side]], [[west]], [[east]], [[resistance]], [[civilian]], [[sideUnknown]], [[sideFriendly]], [[sideEnemy]], [[playerSide]], [[side location]], [[Side relations]], [[independent]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 16:00, 3 December 2013 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Ondřejkuzel|Ondřejkuzel]]</dt>
<dd class="note">For units, vehicles you can use: "'''[[Array|array]] [[joinSilent]] [[createGroup]] [[Side]]'''", e.g. in init: "[this] joinSilent createGroup EAST;"  ''described in the note below''
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 19:05, 6 August 2009 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Jtgibson|Jtgibson]]</dt>
<dd class="note">This is a frequent question on OFPEC, but produced here because it was difficult to find an answer to.  '''setSide''' does not work for men, vehicles, etc.: it is intended for locations (''i.e.'', territory).  If you want to switch a unit's (''e.g.'', the player's) side in the middle of a battle, make the unit '''[[joinSilent]]''' a group on the given side instead.  If you want the unit to become the group leader after joining, use '''[[selectLeader]]'''.  I have not tested the idea of spawning a temporary unit of that side, assigning the player to that unit, setting the player as the leader, then deleting the original unit, but I don't see why it wouldn't work.  (It begs the question why we don't have a setSide object function, though.)
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
